entries.title: Female NCAA athletes protest, threaten legal action over 'trans' athlete policy
entries.description:
On Thursday, female NCAA athletes gathered outside the San Antonio NCAA convention to protest the NCAA's inclusion of biological males in women's sports. The group was led by former Kentucky swimmer Riley Gaines, who competed against Lia Thomas at last year's national championships. Gaines and Thomas tied for fifth place in the 200 freestyle.

Lia Thomas was also nominated for NCAA "Woman of the Year."

\u201c"It's a slap in the face... it's just completely abysmal."\n\nRiley Gaines speaks to Piers Morgan about being up against transgender swimmer Lia Thomas for Woman of the Year.\n\n@RileyGaines | @piersmorgan | @TalkTV | #LiaThomas\u201d
— Piers Morgan Uncensored (@Piers Morgan Uncensored) 1658176725

The Independent Council on Women’s Sports [ICONS] sent a letter to the NCAA threatening legal action if the organization declines to change its policy on males competing in woman's sports. Marshi Smith, a co-founder of ICONS, told The Daily Signal, “We are advocating for the original intent of Title IX as written 50 years ago that ensures women are not discriminated against on the basis of sex. The Biden administration’s efforts to equate sex with gender identity undermine all sex-based protections for women.”

Males competing in women's sports is rapidly becoming the norm nationwide. In March of last year, Lia Thomas became the first biological male to win an NCAA national women's sports title. In October, Randolph Union High School in Vermont broke news for forcing female athletes to share a locker room with biological males. The school actually punished girls who complained about the policy.

\u201cNEW: @DailySignal spent this week in Randolph, Vermont, speaking to high school girls who face heavy criticism + potential punishment from their school for pushing back against a biological male using their locker room. Here's what these girls have to say for themselves:\u201d
— Mary Margaret Olohan (@Mary Margaret Olohan) 1665693833

On the flip side, in 2018, wrestler Mack Beggs continued to compete against women while she took testosterone for her female-to-male transition. As you would guess, this led to her absolutely dominating the field, since she was essentially 'roided up. In 2021, Beggs spoke out about the "toll" all that winning and competing against women took on her. Boohoo.

To my fellow current and former female athletes out there, my advice is to enjoy it while you can. One day, you may just find yourself lining up against a 6'4, 275-pound bearded "woman." Women's sports were fun while they lasted!

Editor’s Note

entries.title: 'Cops can't do it all by themselves': Hero veteran who took down knife-wielding Walmart maniac speaks out
entries.description:
Earlier this month, a deranged man with a knife threatened to stab customers in a South Carolina Walmart before he was quickly neutralized by a bystander. The assailant waved his pocketknife at customers, and one bystander said he demanded $20, which seems like enough evidence that the perpetrator was not of sound mind. Obviously, theft is evil, but if you're gonna risk jail time, wouldn't you go a little higher than $20? Just saying.

Video of the incident shows one customer attempting to stop the assailant, but he was forced to swerve to avoid the man's flailing knife. Another customer then approaches from behind and smacks him on the noggin with a metal stanchion.

The hero of the story is military veteran Demario Davis. Davis actually tweeted the video of the incident saying, "I just neutralized the situation!" Which is pretty baller.

"We could stop a whole lot more attacks if some citizens just step up."

Air Force veteran Demario Davis recounts taking down an armed shopper at a South Carolina Walmart.

MORE: https://t.co/PskuSZhVEU pic.twitter.com/kxxRzDEcjh
— NEWSMAX (@NEWSMAX) January 13, 2023


Davis told Fox News he heard the man yell, "when the cops get here I'm going to start cutting you all up." He said that's when his military training kicked in, and his first instinct was to "neutralize the situation." And that he did.

Davis continued, "I'm a community person, so if I see something in the community that's not right, with all the violence and things and attacks going on, gun violence you know, you want your people in the community to step up as well. The cops can't do it all by themselves."

Davis also spoke to Newsmax.

"We could stop a whole lot more attacks if some citizens just step up."

Air Force veteran Demario Davis recounts taking down an armed shopper at a South Carolina Walmart.

MORE: https://t.co/PskuSZhVEU pic.twitter.com/kxxRzDEcjh
— NEWSMAX (@NEWSMAX) January 13, 2023

The Walmart in question is located in Richland County, South Carolina. Last fall, the Sheriff of Richland County pleaded for higher deputy pay. He said low wages were making it difficult to keep a full staff, and that the department lost 71 deputies last year.

It's almost as if funding the organizations that protect us would lead to better levels of protection! But at least there are still civilian heroes like Davis out there, waiting in the wings, metal stanchions in hand.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: NHL attempts discriminatory job fair that excludes white men until Ron DeSantis says 'not in Florida'
entries.description:
The National Hockey League (NHL) was planning a job fair in Ft. Lauderdale. The rub is that white men originally needed not to apply. Ron DeSantis reminded the NHL that discrimination is bad and they don't do that in Florida.

The NHL has been under fire by people who don't watch or care about hockey because too many white people work for the company. The solution to increasing diversity was this job fair. One that was exclusive for people who identified as women, Black, Asian/Pacific Islander, Hispanic/Latino (at least they didn't say Latinx), Indigenous, LGBTQIA+, and/or a person with a disability.

Literally, everyone unless you are an able-bodied cracker ass cracker who identifies as a man. Not you.

The Florida Governor's office caught wind of this and said "Nope."

NEW - @GovRonDeSantis spox issues statement condemning NHL for hosting summit where participants must .. “identify as female, Black, Asian/Pacific Islander, Hispanic/Latino ..”

“Discrimination of any sort is not welcome in the state of Florida,” says spox @BryanDGriffin

👇🏽 pic.twitter.com/fPQvS4PAlr
— MAHSA SAEIDI, ESQ.🕵🏼 ‎مهسا (@MahsaWho) January 14, 2023

Press secretary Brian Griffin said in a statement from Governor DeSantis's office: "Discrimination of any sort is not welcome in the state of Florida, and we do not abide by the woke notion that discrimination should be overlooked if applied in a politically popular manner or against a politically unpopular demographic. We are fighting all discrimination in our schools and our workplaces, and we will fight it in publicly accessible places of meeting or activity. We call upon the National Hockey League to immediately remove and denounce the discriminatory prohibitions it has imposed on attendance to the 2023 'Pathway to Hockey' summit."

The NHL bent the knee. The original LinkedIn post has been removed, and the NHL issued a statement claiming the original wording of the LinkedIn post -- the one that went out of its way to identify everyone except for white men -- was inaccurate and indicated that the event is open to all people ages 18 and up.

The NHL should stick to sports and leave the woke virtue signaling into the NBA. Or, if you want to discriminate against white men so badly, California or New York might be better choices.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: SHOCKER: Everyone hates the woke 'adult' Scooby Doo reboot, and it's not just conservative critics
entries.description:
Velma from Scooby-Doo is having a rough go of it. First, she got shamed on the internet for calling the cops on LeBron James. Now her new cartoon Velma (starring Mindy Kaling), where she was stepping out as the lead, is getting panned by critics.

ALL critics, across the board. Because I know some people might be thinking "oh, you conservatives are just upset there is a gay person and are calling it woke." Nope. And the part about Velma being gay is less woke as it is lazy writing. The original Scooby Doo cartoon debuted September 13, 1969. Starting on September 14, 1969 the joke was that Velma was a lesbian, Fred and Daphne were f*cking, and Shaggy was stoned out of his gourd. People have been referencing that for over fifty years. Saying the words out loud in 2023 isn't impressive.

Though they did turn Shaggy into a cuck.

They changed Shaggy to a beta male simp pic.twitter.com/pLWrAAZ9hW
— Mari 💖 (@ComicLoverMari) January 12, 2023

Plus, even corporate media outlets like The Wrap and Variety who praise Velma's sexuality think the rest of the cartoon su-diddly-ucks. They point to "the pointless nudity, the gratuitous violence and gore" and that "these characters are just really unpleasant to spend time with, and it starts at the top with Velma."

This is a problem with these modern reboots. They are meant to target a nostalgic audience. There isn't a modern audience of zoomers clamoring for a cartoon about a talking dog that solves mysteries. The cartoon is meant for people who were fans of the cartoon, but then producers strip away everything that made people love the cartoon so that it fits a "modern audience" who doesn't care about the cartoon.

Velma missed the mark on everyone. Including Catholic priests.

a scene from the new "velma" trailer pic.twitter.com/aY5NwAXubR
— Fr. Miller (@FrMiller) January 12, 2023

Woke progressives who view the cartoon as a parody of woke progressivism hate it too. So much so they accused "secret conservative" Kaling of sabotage.

Velma is… extremely not good.

It reads like a right-wing YouTuber's clumsy understanding of what a "diverse" show is.

Which, given that its showrunner is Mindy Kaling, who has faced criticism for transphobia and once described herself as "way conservative", kind of makes sense pic.twitter.com/LI4wO1e8pN
— Bad Writing Takes 🖊️🏳️🌈 (@BadWritingTakes) January 12, 2023

Velma has the rare honor of being panned on Rotten Tomatoes by both "professional" critics (50%) and the audience (9%). Kaling recently came out and said that The Office, a show that was the most popular streamed show during the pandemic, could NEVER be made today. The fact that she is right about that but a cartoon-like Velma could be made tells you all you need to know about the entertainment industry.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Teen breaks down after being exposed to naked man in locker room, but woke YMCA staff says it was a transwoman so shut up
entries.description:
In the olden days, boys would say they would choose "invisibility" as a superpower to sneak into the girls' locker room. In 2023, you just have to claim you're a woman and are well within your legal right to whip it out in any changing room you like. Women are told it's their fault for having a problem with it, whether they be teen girls in high school or elderly women at the YMCA. It's the woman's fault for assuming the penis they see belongs to a man.

This happened to one teen girl at a YMCA in California (no surprises here). She was upset it happened to her. She grew even more upset thinking about her five-year-old sister who uses the same locker room. What she was told by the YMCA is insane.

Note: The seventeen-year-old did not use the appropriate pronouns in her testimony, so we at the Louder with Crowder Dot Com website made slight edits to the transcript to abide by the AP Styleguide. We strive for inclusivity and would hate to offend the wrong person.

Santee YMCA allows naked man to use women's locker room with underage girls youtu.be

When I asked the YMCA management what their policy was regarding transgenders, they confirmed that the [beautiful and brave woman] that I saw was indeed allowed to shower wherever [she/her] pleased. As long as you are not a red flag on Megan's Law, the California sex offender registry, a grown [transwoman with a penis] can shower alongside a teenage girl at your YMCA location here in Santee.
I was made to feel as though I had done something wrong when I talked to people at the YMCA. Somehow the [what critics call] indecent exposure of a [transwoman with a penis] to a female minor was an inconvenience to them.

The rule in California that I'm sure was the result of "compromise" is that as long as the penis'd person is not a convicted sex offender, they can whip it out in any locker or dressing room they wish. And if YOU have a problem with it, YOU'RE the problem. That's the compromise. That's what California politicians few as "common ground."

This seventeen-year-old's closing question is one that needs to be asked of politicians who support these policies until we get answers for them.

I'm assuming all of you either have a wife, a sister, daughters, or granddaughters or are a woman yourself. Could you knowingly send an underage girl into a room where there was a naked [beautiful and brave transwoman with her cock out] and say that she was not in danger? That she was safe? Or, more importantly, that this was right?

Setting aside I'm sure some of the woke city council members would have to have a sidebar with their wife's other boyfriends in order to find consensus. These elected officials would say that this IS all totally right and that you are a transphobe for asking questions.

Sure, they won't let their daughter or granddaughter use the YMCA locker room. But yours have no choice.
